item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

Bowser jr:

You are not messing up. I guess it is all about taste, as I don’t really like micromanaging games or playing a soviet bureaucrat like in Anno.

Yes, if you want to have fun the whole time I’d recommend Sim City
If you want to build a massive empire with a little hard grind in the beginning, I’d recommend Anno.
They’re too very different play-styles and different taste for sure.

Read full topic

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:31, topic:463499”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=566980.msg4255411#msg4255411 date=1362671295]
What do you mean placing ice cream shops lol.
Anno is 10x more in depth than any simulation game out there. You can spend 3 hours just setting up for later game. Sim City is meant for children having fun.
[/quote]
To increase residential density you need to add attractions to get more people interested in the area. One of those is an ice cream shop.[/quote]
He was making fun of Anno, not Sim City. Unless I’m messing this up.

Read full topic

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:30, topic:463499”]What do you mean placing ice cream shops lol.
Anno is 10x more in depth than any simulation game out there. You can spend 3 hours just setting up for later game. Sim City is meant for children having fun.[/quote]
To increase residential density you need to add attractions to get more people interested in the area. One of those is an ice cream shop.

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

oxi: I know that the Anno games are much more complex, but I don’t really like that type of gameplay. I want to build a city, and not placing ice cream shops to upgrade my houses.

Read full topic

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:27, topic:463499”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=566980.msg4255246#msg4255246 date=1362619372]

We should stop this RSPS shit and work on our own “Mopar” City game. With warfare.

So… a giant free for all risk game?
[/quote]
No. Warfare wouldn’t necessary be the main factor, but an opportunity. A finite resource system would be needed so there would be a reason for war.

Yes you have the Anno XXXX games, but I prefer the Sim City way of making cities and the diplomatic system is too simple in the Anno games.[/quote]
You can’t compare the complexity of Anno to Sim City, meant for children.

Read full topic

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:26, topic:463499”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=566980.msg4255041#msg4255041 date=1362592677]
We should stop this RSPS shit and work on our own “Mopar” City game. With warfare.
[/quote]

So… a giant free for all risk game?[/quote]
No. Warfare wouldn’t necessary be the main factor, but an opportunity. A finite resource system would be needed so there would be a reason for war.

Yes you have the Anno XXXX games, but I prefer the Sim City way of making cities and the diplomatic system is too simple in the Anno games.

Read full topic

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:

Bowser jr:

We should stop this RSPS shit and work on our own “Mopar” City game. With warfare.

So… a giant free for all risk game?

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:23, topic:463499”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=566980.msg4255025#msg4255025 date=1362591134]
You don’t get a region, it’s shared with other people. You have neighbors.

This game really upsets me, I haven’t played it yet but it seems like they’re really taking a stepback from Sim City 4 (you could max out at about 4 million people without the city becoming a loveing mess) but now I’ve heard that after 200k it becomes impossible and the limit just straps you down.

I was also super excited about this game until I’ve been reading reviews (http://arstechnica.com/gaming/2013/03/simcity-impressions-we-waited-ten-years-for-this/ ) I’m sorta sad but not surprised. Just trying to get more buck for their bang.
[/quote]
You can create a private region that is invite only, and if you choose to not invite anyone, it is essentially your own region[/quote]It doesn’t give you more space to build in though

Read full topic

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I bought the pre-release, but I’m waiting a week to play because of all the bugs and shit EA is giving us. This game was NOT ready for release.

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:21, topic:463499”]You don’t get a region, it’s shared with other people. You have neighbors.

This game really upsets me, I haven’t played it yet but it seems like they’re really taking a stepback from Sim City 4 (you could max out at about 4 million people without the city becoming a loveing mess) but now I’ve heard that after 200k it becomes impossible and the limit just straps you down.

I was also super excited about this game until I’ve been reading reviews (http://arstechnica.com/gaming/2013/03/simcity-impressions-we-waited-ten-years-for-this/ ) I’m sorta sad but not surprised. Just trying to get more buck for their bang.[/quote]
You can create a private region that is invite only, and if you choose to not invite anyone, it is essentially your own region

Read full topic

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:20, topic:463499”]I’m not a big fan of the forced city sizes. What happens when you max out your city, and later your region? Time to restart?

Long video, but it shows off a lot of the features of the game, and what isn’t exactly simcity in nature[/quote]
You don’t get a region, it’s shared with other people. You have neighbors.

This game really upsets me, I haven’t played it yet but it seems like they’re really taking a stepback from Sim City 4 (you could max out at about 4 million people without the city becoming a fucking mess) but now I’ve heard that after 200k it becomes impossible and the limit just straps you down.

I was also super excited about this game until I’ve been reading reviews (http://arstechnica.com/gaming/2013/03/simcity-impressions-we-waited-ten-years-for-this/ ) I’m sorta sad but not surprised. Just trying to get more buck for their bang.

Read full topic

item.title: SimCity
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

I’m not a big fan of the forced city sizes. What happens when you max out your city, and later your region? Time to restart?

Long video, but it shows off a lot of the features of the game, and what isn’t exactly simcity in nature

Read full topic
